answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Andy - Surprise and Casa Grande AZ are both using solar at city owned facilities.  Casa Grande just presented at the annual ACMA Conference re: their solar efforts.  This is a link to their PPT.
http://azmanagement.org/docs/presos/14summer_conf/rf_community/casa_grande.pptx
Pam

answers.author: Donald Gloo
answers.text:
Andy,
The Village of Wind Point, WI, installed solar panels on their municipal garage about 5 years ago. They have the same climate as Bayside, and they probably have some good data by now.
dg


Andy,

dg

answers.author: Lisa LaRocque
answers.text:
The City of Las Cruces, NM is also adding solar installations to its municipal buildings. This has often been in association with LEED certified buildings. The City has used bonds and grants to fund these projects. In the future we may explore purchase power agreements and Energy Service Companies (ESCO's). Here is a ppt discussion our major efforts.


The City of Las Cruces, NM is also adding solar installations to its municipal buildings. This has often been in association with LEED certified buildings. The City has used bonds and grants to fund these projects. In the future we may explore purchase power agreements and Energy Service Companies (ESCO's). Here is a ppt discussion our major efforts.

answers.author: Tim McCarty
answers.text:
The City of Walla Walla entered into a partnership with Walla Walla Flat Roof Educational Energy that provides for a solar panel installation on City property adjacent to the Waste Water Treatment Plan. Generated power is donated to the City. Portions of the project are owned in part by local participants who receive production incentives from Washington State. The Walla Walla Flat Roof Educational Energy contact is:
 Frederic Liebrand
1776 Stateline Road
Walla Walla, WA  99362
Frederic.Liebrand@wallawalla.edu

answers.author: Jesse Himes
answers.text:
Hi Andrew,
Solar energy has been a hot topic recently. The Knowledge Network has a whole group and topic area devoted to solar energy. Here are the links:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/292/Solar_Energy
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/groups/kn/Group/1226/Solar_Energy
Additionally, I found some resources that may be helpful.
Some cities are starting to recycle land in order to develop solar energy fields. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304681/Recycling_Land_for_Solar_Energy_Development
Many other cities have to develop regulations for solar energy integration. That briefing paper can be found here:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304679/Integrating_Solar_Energy_into_Local_Development_Regulations
I hope this helps! Keep asking great questions, too!
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

answers.author: David Thurnau
answers.text:
Hello Andy,
It's good to hear that Wisconsin municipalities are considering solar.  The company I work for, Community Green Energy, which is located in Lake Geneva, WI, works with communities to develop solar energy solutions, with an emphasis on developing community solar projects: https://communitygreenenergy.com/community-virtual-solar-garden/ .
Wisconsin does present some hurdles to municipalities looking to install solar, mainly because the third party ownership model is currently unavailable, though that may change in the near future.  I'd be happy to discuss solar options available in Wisconsin further with you, just feel free to reach out to me at dthurnau@theadmincenter.com.
David Thurnau

Wisconsin does present some hurdles to municipalities looking to install solar, mainly because the third party ownership model is currently unavailable, though that may change in the near future.  I'd be happy to discuss solar options available in Wisconsin further with you, just feel free to reach out to me at dthurnau@theadmincenter.com.

David Thurnau

answers.author: Emily Dodson
answers.text:
Hello Andy,
Under ICMA's Department of Energy funded Solar Outreach Partnership project and the SunShot Initiative, a wealth of information about installing solar on government facilities has been published. I would encourage you to check out the SunShot Solar Resource Center: http://www4.eere.energy.gov/solar/sunshot/resource_center/filter?topic%5B%5D=19
Also, if you have any specific questions, ICMA has a free "Ask an Expert" service to answer solar related inquiries. Just email your question(s) to solar@icma.org.
Good luck!

Also, if you have any specific questions, ICMA has a free "Ask an Expert" service to answer solar related inquiries. Just email your question(s) to solar@icma.org.

Good luck!

author: Andrew Pederson
text:
Wondering if any communities have implemented solar power into
municipal facilities.  If so, please let me know what you did, analysis for the project,
who you worked and any results to date.
title: Solar energy in Municpal facilities
